# OpenBB Docs - python

## Docs

- [Basic Usage](https://docs.openbb.co/python/basic_usage/index): This sections provides guidance for query syntax, expected outputs, and importing the OpenBB Python Package as part of another application.
- [Input Query Parameters](https://docs.openbb.co/python/basic_usage/query_parameters): This page provides comprehensive information about standardized command syntax across OpenBB Python Extension endpoints.
- [Response Model Output](https://docs.openbb.co/python/basic_usage/response_model): This page details the basic response and output that can be expected to be received from the the ODP Python Package.
- [Architecture Overview](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/architecture_overview): This guide provides insights into the architecture and components of the ODP Python Package. It covers the key classes, import statements, and the TET pattern used in building the Fetcher classes.
- [Charting Extensions](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/extension_types/charting): This page is a guide for adding custom views to any router endpoint that are included with the response object when the user sets `chart=True`.
- [From FastAPI](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/extension_types/from_fastapi): This page explains how to convert an existing FastAPI application to an ODP Python Package, without changing any code.
- [Introduction](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/extension_types/index): An overview of the three types of OpenBB extensions.
- [OBBject Extensions](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/extension_types/obbject): This page provides information about how to write extensions for the OBBject class and Python interface response object.
- [OBBject Plugins](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/extension_types/plugins): This page provides information about how to write plugin extensions that intercept the application output immediately before returning to the user. They provide a way to conditionally alter the output of any command, including those you do not control.
- [Provider Extensions](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/extension_types/provider): This page provides information about how to write provider extensions for the OpenBB Python Package using the ETL pattern, and how to add them to Routers as endpoints.
- [Router Extensions](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/extension_types/router): This page provides information about how to write router extensions for the OpenBB Python Package.
- [Annotated Results](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/how-to/annotated_results): This guide provides instructions for returning extra response metadata from Provider extension models. Use this class to include important citations, credits, or other dictionary-like items that should not be included in table or chart data.
- [Deprecating Endpoints](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/how-to/deprecating_endpoints): This guide provides detailed instructions on how to deprecate an endpoint in the ODP Python Package.
- [Disabling Output Validation](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/how-to/disabling_output_validation): This page provides instructions for disabling output validation, when defining a new router function.
- [Dynamic Command Execution](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/how-to/dynamic_command_execution): This guide provides detailed instructions on how to execute commands dynamically in the OpenBB Python Package.
- [Function Examples](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/how-to/examples): This page explains how to add examples and code snippets to API and Python endpoints.
- [HTTP Requests](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/how-to/http_requests): This guide outlines OpenBB processes for making HTTP requests synchronously and asynchronously. Using the helpers will keep the codebase leaner and easier to maintain by eliminating duplicate processes. Anyone can build effective and efficient data fetchers, this guide outlines how to import and implement either type of request into any fetcher.
- [How-To](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/how-to/index): Quick how-to guides for developers that cover key concepts.
- [Tests](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/how-to/tests): This section provides an in-depth look at the Quality Assurance (QA) process in the Open Data Platform. It covers the use of QA tools for testing extensions, creation of unit and integration tests, and the importance of maintaining a short import time for the package.
- [Validators](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/how-to/validators): This guide describes the use of validators with model inputs and outputs.
- [Developer](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/index): An overview of getting started developing with the OpenBB Python Package and extensions.
- [Standardization](https://docs.openbb.co/python/developer/standardization): Learn about standardization techniques for consistent inputs and outputs across the OpenBB Python Package.
- [openbb-econometrics](https://docs.openbb.co/python/extensions/data-processing/econometrics): An overview of the `openbb-econometrics` Python package.
- [openbb-quantitative](https://docs.openbb.co/python/extensions/data-processing/quantitative): An overview of the `openbb-quantitative` Python package.
- [openbb-technical](https://docs.openbb.co/python/extensions/data-processing/technical): An overview of the `openbb-technical` Python package for time series analysis.
- [Introduction](https://docs.openbb.co/python/extensions/index): An overview of installable ODP Python packages and extensions.
- [openbb-charting](https://docs.openbb.co/python/extensions/infrastructure/openbb-charting/index): Learn about the openbb-charting extension and adding Plotly charts to the response object.
- [Technical Indicators](https://docs.openbb.co/python/extensions/infrastructure/openbb-charting/indicators): A tutorial of the technical indicators included with the openbb-charting library, including how to get started using them.
- [openbb-api](https://docs.openbb.co/python/extensions/interface/openbb-api): Learn how to use a Python tool to generate widgets.json from an openapi.json file.
- [openbb-mcp](https://docs.openbb.co/python/extensions/interface/openbb-mcp): Learn how to use the `openbb-mcp-server` Python library to convert a FastAPI application into a Workspace-ready MCP server.
- [openbb-core](https://docs.openbb.co/python/extensions/openbb-core): Learn about the openbb-core package and its role as the base layer.
- [Providers](https://docs.openbb.co/python/extensions/providers/index): This page describes the toolkit extensions available for the Open Data Platform.
- [Data and Data Providers](https://docs.openbb.co/python/faqs/data_providers): This page contains some frequently asked questions about OpenBB data and providers.
- [Errors](https://docs.openbb.co/python/faqs/errors): This page contains some frequently asked questions about Open Data Platform errors.
- [License](https://docs.openbb.co/python/faqs/license): As we adopt the Affero General Public License (AGPL) for Open Data Platform by OpenBB, we understand you may have questions about how this change affects your use of the platform. Below are some frequently asked questions to help clarify the implications of our new licensing model.
- [Introduction](https://docs.openbb.co/python/index): Introduction to the Open Data Platform Python packages; a convenient and powerful tool that provides pre-built data connectors and libraries to design and build financial reports and applications. Learn more about the open source ecosystem, packages, and how to contribute.
- [Installation](https://docs.openbb.co/python/installation): This page presents the general system requirements, supported environments, installation procedures, and setup for running the Open Data Platform - by OpenBB.
- [Quick Start](https://docs.openbb.co/python/quickstart/index): Get started with the OpenBB Platform by following this quickstart guide for the Python interface.
- [MCP Server](https://docs.openbb.co/python/quickstart/mcp): This page details the basics for getting started running the ODP Python Package as a MCP server.
- [REST API](https://docs.openbb.co/python/quickstart/rest_api): This page details the basics for getting started using the OpenBB Python Package as a REST API.
- [Workspace Integration](https://docs.openbb.co/python/quickstart/workspace): Get started using the Open Data Platform as a custom Workspace backend. Create visualizations, dashboards, and generate AI insights by connecting your ODP Python Packages directly to the Workspace UI.
- [Reference](https://docs.openbb.co/python/reference/index): <ReferenceCard
- [Environment Variables](https://docs.openbb.co/python/settings/environment_variables): This section details configuring the ODP settings and environment variables.
- [Settings](https://docs.openbb.co/python/settings/index): This section details the various user and system settings and preferences for the ODP Python Package.
- [MCP Settings](https://docs.openbb.co/python/settings/mcp_settings): This section details configuring the ODP settings and environment variables.
- [System Settings](https://docs.openbb.co/python/settings/system_settings): This section details configuring the ODP settings and environment variables.
- [API Keys](https://docs.openbb.co/python/settings/user_settings/api_keys): An overview for setting up the Open Data Platform Python client and Fast API with data provider API keys.
- [Defaults](https://docs.openbb.co/python/settings/user_settings/defaults): This section details configuring the Open Data Platform settings and environment variables.
- [User Settings](https://docs.openbb.co/python/settings/user_settings/index): This section describes the `user_settings.json` file.
- [Preferences](https://docs.openbb.co/python/settings/user_settings/preferences): This section details configuring the Open Data Platform settings and environment variables.
